segment.source: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you can choose an installation that integrates Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: When you install Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you can choose an installation that integrates Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring with System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For a list of the supported versions of Configuration Manager, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For a list of the supported versions of Configuration Manager, see Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: This integration moves the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring compliance and reporting infrastructure into the native environment of Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: This integration moves the Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring compliance and reporting infrastructure into the native environment of Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: With the Configuration Manager topology, IT administrators can view reports and the compliance status of their enterprise from the Configuration Manager Management Console.
segment.target: With the Configuration Manager topology, IT administrators can view reports and the compliance status of their enterprise from the Configuration Manager Management Console.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: Windows To Go is not supported when you install the integrated topology of MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: Getting Started – Using MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Getting Started – Using MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: This section describes how MBAM works with Configuration Manager and explains the recommended architecture for deploying MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.
segment.target: This section describes how MBAM works with Configuration Manager and explains the recommended architecture for deploying MBAM with the Configuration Manager Integration topology.

segment.target: Planning to Deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: This section describes the installation prerequisites, supported configurations, and hardware and software requirements that you need to consider before you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager topology.
segment.target: This section describes the installation prerequisites, supported configurations, and hardware and software requirements that you need to consider before you install MBAM with the Configuration Manager topology.

segment.source: Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager
segment.target: Deploying MBAM with Configuration Manager

segment.source: This section describes how to deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager, and includes instructions for installing and configuring the MBAM on the Administration and Monitoring Server and Configuration Manager Server.
segment.target: This section describes how to deploy MBAM with Configuration Manager, and includes instructions for installing and configuring the MBAM on the Administration and Monitoring Server and Configuration Manager Server.

segment.source: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager
segment.target: Understanding MBAM Reports in Configuration Manager

segment.source: This section describes the MBAM reports that you can run from Configuration Manager to show the compliance of your enterprise and compliance of individual computers in your enterprise.
segment.target: This section describes the MBAM reports that you can run from Configuration Manager to show the compliance of your enterprise and compliance of individual computers in your enterprise.
